title: Apply orange/yellow primary theme with blue secondary, green accent, light background, and orange→yellow gradient buttons

requirements.text: Update the app’s global theme tokens to match the provided palette across all pages and roles (storefront, customer, vendor, admin) by setting Tailwind/shadcn CSS variables for: Primary = orange/yellow, Secondary = blue, Accent = green, Background = light grey/white. Ensure text/foreground colors remain readable with sufficient contrast on the new background and on primary/secondary/accent surfaces.

quotes:
Use this color palette:

Primary: Orange / Yellow

Secondary: Blue

Accent: Green

Background: Light grey / white

acceptanceCriteria: Global theme variables used by Tailwind/shadcn (e.g., --background/--foreground/--primary/--secondary/--accent and their *-foreground counterparts) reflect the requested palette in the active (light) theme.
All major surfaces (page background, cards/popovers, nav bars) render on a light grey/white background without low-contrast text.
Secondary UI elements that previously used the old secondary color now render as blue (e.g., secondary badges/buttons/links where applicable).
Accent UI elements that previously used the old accent color now render as green (e.g., highlights/success-like accents where applicable).

requirements.text: Implement a consistent primary call-to-action button style that uses an orange→yellow gradient (left-to-right) and apply it to primary CTA actions across the app (e.g., Add to Cart, Checkout, Place Order, Save, Create/Update actions in admin/vendor dialogs) without editing any files under the immutable shadcn/ui component sources. Use only English for any user-facing button text that is updated during this work.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary CTA buttons render with a visible orange→yellow gradient and appropriate hover/active/focus states.
Gradient CTA buttons have readable text (e.g., white or high-contrast foreground) and a clear focus ring consistent with the updated theme.

No direct edits are made inside the immutable UI component directory (frontend/src/components/ui); gradient styling is applied via composition, utility classes, or wrapper components and then used throughout the app.
Buttons that represent destructive actions (delete/remove/cancel) do not use the orange→yellow gradient and continue to use a destructive styling.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only shadcn/ui sources); apply styling via composition/wrappers/className usage.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: No new backend features or schema changes.
No new pages or routing changes.
No third-party design systems beyond the existing Tailwind + shadcn setup.
